chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale Richard Coggin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dale Richard Coggin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dale Richard Coggin was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

-$2554.00 to be collected by Clerk of Courts office and payment plan approved.

-In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

From DE requesting his current bal & next pymt due date. Ret'd call to DE & left a v/m stating his current bal is $350 & his next pymt of $75 is due by 10-15-19. DE was encouraged to continue paying ahead if he can. jaf

DE called inquiring if he could make pymt over the ph.  DE was given the pymt options then stated he would just come in to make a pymt.  DE inquired when his pymt is actually due & was given a due date of the 15th of ea mo.  DE was also given a current bal of $700 & advised that his next pymt isn't due until 5-15-19 as he's pd ahead.  DE was encouraged to pay off his bal ahead of time if possible.  jaf

From DE on 8-10-18 stating he had questions about his Pymt Plan & inquiring if he can make larger pymts.  Ret'd call to DE & left a v/m stating he may make larger pymts & that we did receive pymt for $375 today.  DE to return my call if he has further questions.  jaf

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Rohan. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Angela Raye Olson   DF:  Dale Richard Coggin appeared. Includes: 15CF185 and 15TR1731. Cases called at: 10:56 am. ADA McKinley provides joint recommendation to Court. Atty Olson responds. ADA McKinley addresses Amended Complaint regarding amendment to misdemeanor. Atty Olson addresses Court regarding treatment. AODA has been completed. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 15CF185. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF185. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CF185 and 15TR1731. Atty Olson requests exemption for IID for son's vehicle. Atty Olson marks Exhibit #1 - Letter from American Association, #1 O/R, and Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:
Sent W/H with 3 years probation with conditions:
- 90 days conditional time to be served beginning today at St Croix County Jail with Huber granted for work, AODA, treatment, medical treatment 
- $52 blood draw - restitution to State Patrol
- $2,502 costs (includes costs)
- 27 month license revocation
- 27 month IID
- AODA and Driver's Safety plan
- Absolute sobriety
- DNA sample 
- Credit for Administrative Suspension
- 1 day credit
- Apply bond on file
- Balance on payment plan
